question:
Which of the following keyboard shortcuts is used to perform REDO operation in MS-Word?

RRB NTPC Stage-II 13/06/2022 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The keyboard shortcut used to perform the REDO operation in MS-Word is Ctrl + Y.
  • Redo reverses the last Undo action, restoring the change that was undone.
  • Other options like Ctrl + R are used for different functions (Ctrl + R aligns text right in Word).
  • Alt + Z and Alt + Y are not standard shortcuts for Redo in MS-Word.

Additional Information:

  • The shortcut for Undo in MS-Word is Ctrl + Z.
  • Redo is useful when you want to revert the Undo action quickly.
  • Knowing these shortcuts improves productivity and ease of editing in MS-Word.

question:
Which of the following is NOT a valid option in the ‘Paragraph’ setting window in MS-Word 2016?

RRB NTPC Stage-II 14/06/2022 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The ‘Paragraph’ setting window in MS-Word 2016 includes options like Indentation, Pagination, and Spacing.
  • These options control how paragraphs are formatted regarding space, breaks, and indentation.
  • Effects is NOT a valid option in the Paragraph settings window; it is related to text formatting but found elsewhere, such as in the Font or Text Effects menus.
  • Therefore, (d) Effects is the correct answer.

Additional Information:

  • Indentation controls the left and right margins of a paragraph.
  • Pagination manages how paragraphs break across pages (like widow/orphan control).
  • Spacing adjusts the space before and after paragraphs and line spacing.
  • Effects typically include shadow, reflection, glow, etc., for text appearance, not paragraph formatting.

question:

solution:

  • You can apply it by selecting text and clicking the Strikethrough button or using keyboard shortcuts (e.g., Ctrl + 5 in Word).

question:

question:
